alert.note: Alert for Albany; Laramie (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 12 at 2:59PM MDT until June 12 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Albany County in southeastern Wyoming... Northwestern Laramie County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 600 PM MDT. * At 259 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Horse Creek and otherwise rural areas of northwestern Laramie County and southeastern Albany County. This includes the following streams and drainages... Horse Creek, Lost Corner Creek, Schoolhouse Creek, Horse Creek Oil Field, South Fork Bear Creek, Sand Creek, Dry Creek, North Bear Creek, Nimmo Draw, Carey Creek, North Fork Mill Creek, Shelton Draw, Bear Creek, Antelope Draw, South Fork Little Bear Creek, Spring Creek, South Chugwater Creek, Paulson Branch, Brunyansyi Draw, North Fork Horse Creek, Chugwater Creek, Ricker Creek, South Fork Horse Creek and Little Bear Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
